extendedInfo.description: Kabuto is a fast and accurate Japanese-English, English-Japanese, and kanji dictionary that gives you the power of a large dictionary on your android phone.Key features:* It's simple.- Easy to use interface that makes searching a breeze.* It's fast with results appearing as you type.* It's accurate.- Uses our unique scoring algorithm.- Over 90% accuracy for the top three results.* It's comprehensive.- Over 252,000 entries in seven dictionaries covering general, computer, medical, scientific, financial, and legal terms and kanji.* It's small.- Download only the dictionaries you need.- Downloading all dictionaries only requires 12.3MBs- Installing all dictionaries only requires 24.7MBs on SD card* It's excellent for beginners and experts.- Search words by kanji, reading, or meaning.- Search kanji by kanji, reading, meaning, radicals, and stroke count- View results and enter terms in kana or romaji. (under Preferences)- Powerful search options under Settings.- Includes stroke order animations for 1,945 Joyo kanji (Japanese educational standard).- Add a result to your favorites list for later review.- Browse past results in the history list.- Copy result fields to the clipboard.- Paste text in the search field.- Does not require an Internet connection to use after initial dictionary download.About permissions:- Kabuto requires Internet access to download the dictionaries.- Kabuto requires write access to the SD card to install the dictionaries.

reviews.title: Best jpn dic
reviews.comment: Love the UI and very usable. Dictionary seems to be more comprehensive than others. Highly recommend.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Hmm
reviews.comment: Its good that it acknowledge james breen because its one of the best japanese dictionary.. but this doesn\'t give example in a sentence like JED does.. it would be nice to have each reading of a kanji in sentences.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It\'s really cool.
reviews.comment: It can do so much. Definitely the best I\'ve seen
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Missing definitions
reviews.comment: Missing definitions. I can\'t find words that are easily accessible in the iOS app Kotoba.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best so far
reviews.comment: I was looking for a completely FREE (no ADS) JAP <-> ENG offline dictionary. I tried JED but it didn\'t work in my device. I tried the \"offline dictionary\" but it comes with ADS and it wasn\'t that good.  Kabuto is from \"Gakusoft\" (the creators of KingKanji in PocketPc... possibly soon in Android?), which for me, its a very good thing. Highly recommended!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: error on downloading directories
reviews.comment: quick question, is anybody else having problems downloading the general directory? i always end up getting an error at around 62%
reviews.author: Brian Lagrosa

reviews.title: Brilliant--the best Japanese dictionary
reviews.comment: I use both JED and Aedict, but this one trumps them both. Excellent and smooth. Auto Romaji input is well thought of. One thing: Needs better kanji stroke animation.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best Japanese language app
reviews.comment: I\'m really impressed with this app in class, for fun and in Japan on holidays. I\'m giving it 5 stars despite 1 bug - it freezes a lot in ICS on my Galaxy S2. You can restart it easily. Just a small irritation.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love It
reviews.comment: I have used Kabuto products like King Kanji and the Kabuto Windows Smartphone dictionary for years. This continues the Kabuto tradition of excellence. It is better and cheaper than the Windows version. It is also better and more usable than the large print dictionaries - like my Kenkyusha Japanese-English Dictionary. One of the reasons that it is so great is that it is so easy to search.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Simply amazing
reviews.comment: Thanks a million for this fascinating app, its easy to use and very helpful, couldnt find a better dictionary
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Accurate
reviews.comment: Used Jed for a while, switched to this. Don\'t like green, but seems more accurate. would be nice to have a widget though (I can dream!) \343\200\200\343\200\200Will update in a month after I use it everyday \343\201\202\343\202\212\343\201\214\343\201\250\343\201\206\343\201\224\343\201\226\343\201\204\343\201\276\343\201\227\343\201\237\343\200\202
reviews.author: Brian Pennington

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: Only english-jap that successfully installed on my phone
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Glad to see Gakusoft coming back into the game. Looking forward to King Kanji on Android. This app works great as a full function dictionary.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice.
reviews.comment: But needs a section on the basic theory of Kanji characters for we neophytes.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best!!!
reviews.comment: ^^ love it. Easy to search and it shows both words in kanji, katakana or hiragana
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: My favorite dictionary
reviews.comment: Its very complete,  with good translations, it would be awesome if there were examples of the use of the word and some gramatical classification for the word,  maybe for some premium version
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good, but...
reviews.comment: It force closes on me at least twice a day. Had to do a battery pull just to get my phone working from an fc when I woke up today.  It\'s still a great app even with those problems, but please fix...  Samsung E4GT
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: This is what I\'ve been looking for! Arigatou ne
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app!
reviews.comment: It\'s really handy for those learning Japanese. My only issue is it force closes when I exit the app and reopen it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.comment: Simple, fast and fulfil what I need. Best free app.
reviews.author: A Google User
